title: Could humans change the trajectory of an asteroid heading towards Earth using existing technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Right now there is no existing technology that could do this, and there won't be without considerable money and effort spent on it. While it's fun to talk about gravity tractors and laser ablation thrusters, neither of these things exist outside of drawings and napkin calculations. Possible in the future? Yes. Right now? Nope.

Yes, but it would need to be detected a decade or more in advance in order for us to have the time to plan and execute the mission. The trajectory change would need to be far in advance of impact, the longer the better.
